TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ValuePattern extends System.Windows.Automation.BasePattern

Docs.summary: Represents a control that has an intrinsic value that does not span a range and can be represented as a string. This string may or may not be editable depending on the control and its settings.
Gets the cached [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Cached property values must have been previously requested using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>. To get the value of a property at the current point in time, get the property by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.Current%2A>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.ValuePatternInformation>.

Docs.exception: The requested property is not in the cache.

Docs.summary: Gets the current [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This pattern must be from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode> reference in order to get current values. If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> was obtained using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode>, it contains only cached data, and attempting to get the current value of any property raises an exception. Use <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.Cached%2A> to get the cached value of a property that was previously specified using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.ValuePatternInformation>.

## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePatternIdentifiers>.
A control should have its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.IsEnabledProperty> set to `true` and its IsReadOnlyProperty set to `false` before a client attempts a call to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.SetValue%2A>.
## Examples In the following example, a root element is passed to a function that returns a collection of UI automation elements that are descendants of the root and satisfy a set of property conditions.
[!code-cs[UIAValuePattern_snip#100](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/UIAValuePattern_snip/UIAValuePattern_snippets.cs#100)] [!code-vb[UIAValuePattern_snip#100](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/UIAValuePattern_snip/UIAValuePattern_snippets.vb#100)]

## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePatternIdentifiers>.
The pattern identifier is passed to methods such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPattern%2A> to retrieve the control pattern of interest from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern> control pattern is obtained from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
[!code-cs[UIAValuePattern_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/UIAValuePattern_snip/UIAValuePattern_snippets.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIAValuePattern_snip#101](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/UIAValuePattern_snip/UIAValuePattern_snippets.vb#101)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetValue(string value) cil managed

Docs.param: Value to set. The UI Automation provider is responsible for converting the value to the appropriate data type.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Single-line edit controls support programmatic access to their contents through <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern>. However, multi-line edit controls do not support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern>; instead they provide access to their content through the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>control pattern.
## Examples In the following example, an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> that supports the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern>control pattern has its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.ValueProperty> set to a user-specified value.
[!code-cs[UIAValuePattern_snip#103](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/UIAValuePattern_snip/UIAValuePattern_snippets.cs#103)] [!code-vb[UIAValuePattern_snip#103](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/UIAValuePattern_snip/UIAValuePattern_snippets.vb#103)]

## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePatternIdentifiers>.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern> object obtained from a target control is passed into a function that retrieves the current <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern> property values.
[!code-cs[UIAValuePattern_snip#102](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/UIAValuePattern_snip/UIAValuePattern_snippets.cs#102)] [!code-vb[UIAValuePattern_snip#102](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/UIAValuePattern_snip/UIAValuePattern_snippets.vb#102)]
